New Records: Austria conceded the fastest-ever goal in the knockout stage of a European Championship after just 57 seconds.
Key Match Events: Turkey took the lead inside a minute with a goal by Merih Demiral.
Mert Gunok made an astonishing reflex save from Christoph Baumgartner’s header in the final seconds of the game.
Arda Guler's corner led to Turkey's second goal, scored by Merih Demiral.
Austria's Marcel Sabitzer was hit on the side of the head by a coin thrown from the stands.
Pre-Game Insights: Austria were known for their fast starts, having scored early in previous matches and even holding the record for the fastest goal in international football.
Post-Match Reflections: Ralf Rangnick, Austria manager, expressed disbelief at being eliminated and emphasized the need to carry the experience into future competitions.
Mert Gunok, Turkey goalkeeper, expressed confidence and morale boost from the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Supporters threw plastic cups onto the pitch, causing interruptions.
The match was played at a frenetic pace with relentless attacking from both sides.
Rain in the second half added to the chaotic nature of the game.
